title.rendered: Clay Tryan: Net Worth 2023, Career Earnings, Wife

content.rendered:
Summary

  • About Clay Tryan
    • Early and Professional Career
  • Clay Tryan’s Net Worth in 2023
    • Career Earnings
    • Endorsements
  • Personal Details
    • Wife
    • How old is he?
    • Height and Weight
    • FAQs About Clay Tryan

Clay Tryan is a renowned rodeo contestant, particularly known for his skills in team roping. Born in Billings, Montana, Tryan turned professional in 1997 and has since made a significant impact on the rodeo scene. He is a three-time World Champion in team roping, having won the title in 2005, 2013, and 2014.

Here we have Clay Tryan’s net worth, career earnings, professional career, achievements, relationship status, and more.

About Clay Tryan

Clay Tryan was born in Born in Billings, Montana. His early life was deeply influenced by his father’s involvement in rodeo. He honed his skills at MetraPark, practicing and competing with his father. It was during these sessions that Clay realized his ambition to become a professional team roper.

In addition to his rodeo career, Tryan is a family man with a wife and three sons. His sons have shown interest in following in their father’s footsteps, developing a passion for roping.

Early and Professional Career

Clay Tryan’s professional career began in 1997, and he made his first NFR appearance in 2001 with Caleb Twisselman. Since then, he has qualified for the NFR 20 times, missing only two years between 2001 and 2022. 

He has won three world championships in team roping (2005, 2013-14) and two average titles (2004, 2014).

Tryan has qualified for the National Finals Rodeo (NFR) 20 times, marking a significant milestone in his career. His 20th appearance at the NFR in 2022 was particularly noteworthy as he surpassed $3 million in career earnings, making him the highest-earning team roper in Professional Rodeo Cowboys Association (PRCA) history.

Throughout his career, Tryan has partnered with several ropers, including Jade Corkill and Travis Graves. With Corkill, Tryan has achieved significant success, including winning the prestigious Cheyenne Frontier Days.

Clay Tryan’s Net Worth in 2023

As of 2023, Clay Tryan’s net worth is estimated to be $6 million.

His net worth is primarily derived from his career earnings in professional rodeo. He has won $3 million in career earnings from competition, making him one of the most successful people to compete in team roping.

Career Earnings

Clay Tryan, a renowned rodeo contestant, has had a successful career in the sport, amassing significant earnings over the years. In 2023, he finished fifth in the world standings with earnings of $154,767.

His regular-season earnings for the 2022 season were $107,368. As of October 2023, his career earnings total $3,196,105.

Endorsements

Clay Tryan, a renowned team roper, has been associated with several endorsements throughout his career. One of the notable endorsements is with Fast Back Ropes.

Personal Details

Wife

Clay Tryan’s wife, Bobbie Tryan, is a significant figure in her own right. She is known for her involvement in the rodeo community, particularly in the roping scene. Like her husband, Bobbie is also a roper and has participated in various roping competitions.

Bobbie was born in Montana and met Clay while roping in their hometown. The couple now resides in Lipan, Texas. They are the proud parents of three sons: Tyler, Braylon, and Dash. All three boys have shown interest in roping.

How old is he?

As of 2023, Clay Tryan is 44 years old.

Height and Weight

He is 5 ft 11 inches and 170 lbs.

FAQs About Clay Tryan

What is Clay Tryan’s Net Worth?

His estimated net worth is $6 million as of 2023.

Where was he born?

Plentywood.

Who is his wife?

Bobbie Tryan.

How many times has he qualified for the NFR?

20 times as of 2023.
